title.narrative: Family Dairy Farm Development in Western Albania Region, Bothar Umbrella Project

description.narrative: his project will improve the economic and social status of 840 poor families in the western region of Albania by developing small family dairy farms. From FY 2010-2013, 420 pregnant Holstein heifers, donated from Bothar Ireland, will be distributed to 14 farmers’ self-help groups in six districts of western Albania. In addition, 420 families in the same communities or nearby villages will benefit from Pass on the Gift. The project will enable participants to generate supplemental income, increase knowledge and skills of the farmers, improve cattle breeds, as well as supporting community development and protecting the environment in the project area. To ensure the sustainability of the project, Heifer International will assist the farmer communities with developing the dairy farms according to their resources, and Heifer will improve the skills and knowledge of local farmers and leaders of Farmers’ Associations. Project trainings will focus on the Values-Based Holistic Community Development model, cattle feeding and nutrition, reproduction, artificial insemination, livestock disease prevention, farm management, marketing and community development. Heifer will strengthen the organizational capacities of the farmers’ groups and associations through training in Heifer’s 12 Cornerstones, leadership development, cooperation and management of farmer organizations.
